III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, a staff member shoved youth into the
shower.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 09/24/2024 by phone.
Complainant stated he called in the allegation on behalf of Youth
A, but did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A stated he was never shoved into a
shower by staff or youth. Youth A was confused on why this
allegation was made on his behalf.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance of this rule. Youth A denied
staff pushing him into a shower.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, a staff member called the youth names. The
staff member mocked the youth for not being able to have a
decent meal like the staff member does when they go home.
Investigation Interviews
2

Complainant was interviewed by phone on 09/24/2024.
Complainant stated he called in the allegation on behalf of Youth
A, but did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A stated a staff (does not know her
name) antagonized him with comments, such as, “Look where you
at” and “Look what you eating tonight.” Youth A stated this staff
also antagonized Youth B and Youth B threw water on this staff.
Youth A stated this staff said “Your mom be sucking dick” to Youth
B after he threw water on her. Youth A stated Youth B is the only
witness to these comments because the other youths were in their
rooms. Youth A did not know the date of this incident.
Youth B was interviewed on 10/10/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth B stated Staff 1 wanted him to enter his
room, but he refused. Youth B stated Staff 1 began to argue with
him and said she was going home “to eat good food” and “buy
$200.00 dollar shoes”. Youth B stated he got mad at Staff 1 for
acting “bougie” (bourgeoise) and tossed some water on her. Youth
B stated another youth (does not know his name but matched the
physical description of Youth A) also went back and forth with
Staff 1 and walked away when Youth B threw the water. Youth B
stated he became worried assistance would be called so he asked
Staff 2 to open his room door. Youth B stated Staff 1 said, “I’m
gonna press charges on your little ass” when he entered his room.
Youth B stated the incident ended when he entered his room and
the door was shut. Youth B stated Staff 2 told him it was not worth
going back and forth with Staff 1. Youth B stated Youth C would
have witnessed his verbal exchange with Staff 1. Youth B did not
know the date of this incident.
Youth C was released from Wayne County Juvenile Detention
and placed with his mother. Attempts were made to interview
Youth C on 10/31/2024 and 11/01/2024. The calls could not be
completed in both attempts.
Staff 1 was interviewed by phone on 10/31/2024 because she
resigned from Wayne County Juvenile Detention on 10/26/2024.
Staff 1 was asked if she recalled an incident when a youth poured
water on her. Staff 1 stated Youth B was upset that she would not
leave his room door unlocked and joked about pouring water on
her. Staff 1 stated she was surprised when Youth B followed
through and threw water from a cup at her. Staff 1 stated she
verbally redirected Youth B and then left Youth B alone to prevent
further escalation. Staff 1 denied taunting or boasting with youths
3

about what she could eat or buy. Staff 1 stated she eats the same
food as the youths during meals when she worked on the unit.
Staff 1 stated she did not know the date Youth B threw water on
her and stated she did not write an incident report.
Staff 2 was interviewed by phone on 10/31/2024. Staff 2 stated
she worked with Staff 1 and did not recall any conflict between
Staff 1 and the youths. Staff 2 was asked if she recalled an
incident involving water being thrown on Staff 1. Staff 2 stated
Youth B threw water on Staff 1 for an unknown reason. Staff 2
recalled Staff 1 was upset that she was wet, but did not verbally
engage with Youth B. Staff 2 stated Youth A was not involved in
this incident. Staff 2 denied Staff 1 taunted the youths about the
food they ate or the clothes or shoes they wore in detention. Staff
2 stated she did not know the date Youth B threw water on Staff 1.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance because there is not enough to
support a rule violation that Staff 1 ridiculed and humiliated Youth
A and Youth B with antagonizing remarks.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Managers and Supervisors are to continue to monitor, redirect or
commend staff on their professionalism.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
